pullrequest.title: Quick fix for config errors after qtutils 2 changes

content.raw:
Interesting - yeah repr() and eval() is not the best for that sort of thing. At least if it were pickling it would have imported Qt4 itself upon unpickling rather than relying on it being in the namespace. That's not a great idea either though - hence ast.literal_eval to ensure you're only using Python built-in types.


Edit: And good to hear about the dragdroptabs - I'll comment on its pull request to see if people are happy to merge it based on this.
content.html:
Interesting - yeah repr() and eval() is not the best for that sort of thing. At least if it were pickling it would have imported Qt4 itself upon unpickling rather than relying on it being in the namespace. That's not a great idea either though - hence ast.literal_eval to ensure you're only using Python built-in types.

Edit: And good to hear about the dragdroptabs - I'll comment on its pull request to see if people are happy to merge it based on this.
